page.title: 09HOUSING AN OVERVIEW
page.content: House styles in the area range from medieval barns, some converted into houses soon after construction and some very recently, to twentieth century housing.There is a fifteenth century yeoman's house in Bexon and a row of seventeenth century tradesmen's properties that have been converted into houses.The villages of Bredgar and Tunstall contain examples of l7th and l8th century architecture often working men's cottages. There are also some small modern estates of three and four bedroomed houses. Many of the older properties have been modernised with the addition of bathrooms, fitted kitchens and central heating. Some houses have replacement double-glazed windows and newly built garages. Gardens of the more modern properties tend to be smaller.
